title: 820-4924-A no Display - missing PP5V_S0_LCD
message:
Hi everyone,

I stuck in a MacBook Pro repair (820-4924-A).
The MacBook is powering on (fanspin, CPU gets warm) but i get no display.
So i started checking the LCD power rails and noticed that PP5VR3V3_SW_LCD is missing (0V) (LCD connector pins 28,29,30).
Here I stuck because of missing experience.
Can anybody give me some hints how to detect why this rail is missing?

Thank you!
Best regards
dudipupan

title: 820-4924-A no Display - missing PP5V_S0_LCD
message:
Did you check  PP5VR3V3_SW_LCD  in the first few seconds?

Be aware, there is no reason to search for internal image/backlight if no external video, nor USB activity; check first.

title: 820-4924-A no Display - missing PP5V_S0_LCD
message:
Thank you again for your reply :-)

I dont't get PP5VR3V3_SW_LCD  in the first few seconds - just checked it with an oscilloscope.

I get the 5V suplly on USB but no activity. And no external display. So the problem is not the missing lcd rail - it's another S0 that holds off the board from booting completely?

title: 820-4924-A no Display - missing PP5V_S0_LCD
message:
Do you get PLT_RESET_L?
If not, check CPU_VCCST_PWRGD and U1950, pins 7 & 3 voltage.

title: 820-4924-A no Display - missing PP5V_S0_LCD
message:
Any history available?
Try known good BIOS file.

title: 820-4924-A no Display - missing PP5V_S0_LCD
message:
The previous owner changed the battery. Before the battery change it worked well without any issues. That's all i know about this board - no signs of liquid or anything else...
Ah and he sent it to me with two PUS - onw of them with too high output voltage (20V) - i don't know if he used the 20V PSU...

How can i flash new BIOS on a MAC? Already did it with a programmer on other Notebooks but never did it with an apple product...

Thank you!

title: 820-4924-A no Display - missing PP5V_S0_LCD
message:
You can remove the chip and use a classic USB programmer.
Or get Medusa programmer and do the job onboard.

All necessary information can be found on the forum.

title: 820-4924-A no Display - missing PP5V_S0_LCD
message:
Thank you!! Bios flash solved the problem. How is that possible that Bios breaks by changing the battery? ?

Now i really got a problem with missing PP5VR3V3_SW_LCD on another board (booting with chimes, external display and 3.3V for few seconds). Should I create a new thread or can I ask you directly in this thread?

Thank you! ?

title: 820-4924-A no Display - missing PP5V_S0_LCD
message:
Glad to hear the problem has been solved.

Please open new thread with other board...

title: 820-4924-A no Display - missing PP5V_S0_LCD
message: After some days the same error occured again. Why is the bios getting bad? Could it be a bad BIOS chip?

title: 820-4924-A no Display - missing PP5V_S0_LCD
message: I think that finally solved the problem, thank you :)
